## Why Do Most AI Adoptions Fail? {.section-header}

::: {.card-grid}

::: {.card}
### Too Many Tools, No Method
Organizations buy AI tools but can't use them effectively. They lack methods to turn tools into workflows.
:::

::: {.card}
### Individuals Can Prompt, But Can't Produce Value
Individual AI ability doesn't equal organizational productivity. There's no systematic approach to operations.
:::

::: {.card}
### AI Projects Can't Demonstrate ROI
Unclear outcomes make it impossible to quantify the real improvements AI brings.
:::

::: {.card}
### Technology Changes Too Fast
New models and frameworks every quarter. Organizations don't know where to start and fear making the wrong bet.
:::

:::

## What is AI Operation? {.section-header}

> **AI Operation is a systematic approach to designing how humans, AI, and processes collaborate.**
>
> It's not about running AI models — it's about how humans design tasks, workflows, and roles to make AI a controllable, learnable, and evolvable partner.

---

## Four Core Layers {.section-header}

| Layer | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| **Methodology** | Principles and thinking models for human-AI collaboration |
| **Framework** | Systematic architecture for AI operation design |
| **Skills** | Standardized AI skill modules, integrable with any framework |
| **Service** | Guided enterprise adoption and continuous evolution support |

---

## What We Don't Do {.section-header}

::: {.not-list}
- **We don't sell AI tools** — We're not a tool vendor; we don't lock you into products
- **We don't lock platforms** — Works with any AI model and framework
- **We don't promise quick fixes** — Building capability takes time and methodology
- **We don't replace humans** — We enhance human capability, not replace it
:::

What we do:

> **Build organizational capability to coexist, collaborate, and co-evolve with AI.**
